We are seeing an interesting phenomenon right now. Interest rates are as low as they are likely to get (low enough that it is damaging some portions of the economy), and government spending is way up. The dollar is still down. This has never happened before.

You also have a situation where scrap comodities (scrap metals) are goin up in price, which has always been a fairly accurate indicator of impending inflation. We have already fired our two biggest "inflation prevention guns". What do we do next to stabilise the dollar?

The moral of the story is: If you can't back it, don't issue it. Short term, a weak dollar is great for large corporations, manufaturers and retailers. It allows them to raise prices without raising eyelids. Inflation is TERRIBLE for the poulation at large. You are working for the same amount of money, but your buying power is greatly decreased.
